text: Steiner's is a great feel at home type bar. They have very reasonable food prices with good sized portions that don't leave you hungry. Their happy hour specials are amazing as well. The service is also top notch, and they treat you like people which is always a plus!

I really liked this place. We ordered burgers since they were having a Saturday game day special. The burgers were all discounted to 8 bucks. I didn't think that was too bad. The only sad thing was our beers coat more than our dinners. 23.00 for 4 beers is kinda steep. Not terrible though. We will be back for the food.
This place has great happy hour prices and decent bar food. Bartenders are very nice as well as all the staff.

This neighborhood pub was just around the corner from my house when I lived in Las Vegas.  Mind you, if you are not a Vegas local, you are unaware to the fact that there are multiple pubs on every street corner.  This is by no mean an anomaly.

My nights here were spent in glory.  Fresh off going live with one of my evening news broadcasts at Channel 8 CBS News, this is where my team would wind up.  An average evening was spent with fellow producers, reporters and photogs.  Always, we received the most special of customer service (even when we were not donned in CBS gear) .. the pub style food is amazing, the martinis are well stirred and the table video blackjack and video poker will score you free drinks and half off on all entrees.  All the bartenders are one of a kind, and the milieu is one of extreme comfortableness.  Never were we hounded due to our news occupations by fans, patrons or workers .. which, was a nice break from the normal fan attack received by local news personalities.

Steiner's Pub is the true definition of a neighborhood pub .. where the food is always good, the bar is always social and the alcohol is always plentiful.

I was so bummed last night I love steiners chicken wigs and sweetpotato fries. I got them to go, so you expect when French fries are stuck in a styrofoam container they'll get a little soggy. These were beyond a little soggy. They were basically noodle French fries they were way under cooked I was so bummed and the wings were barely sauced. Not my favorite location. The location one on blue diamond never disappoints.

We arrived at Steiners at about 2pm.  The day bartender was so inviting, we received great service, and the food was great!  We like to gamble, so we put quite a bit into the machines.  Once the swing shift bartenders came on, it did not matter how much we lost up to that point.  I just finished gambling a $20 when one of the bartenders told us we could no longer sit at the bar, because one of their regulars wanted our seat to play Keno.  He was playing small hands and they kicked us off the bar so that he could sit there.  It was a slap in the face and we left there immediately.  Although we had a great time with the day bartender, we probably won't go back.

This first time experience of mine was Magically Delicious! I highly reccomend the Lamb Chops Dinner! I promise you this... You'll lick the damn plate when it's all said and done :-) But the customer service there is A+ and it's a Great Atmosphere! Big shout out to Regional Manager Roger Sachs for the hook up :-)
Don't listen to the last review, this guy was rude throwing his arms in the air when the bartender was busy with a full bar. I

Deb Penfield is absolutely the best bartender on earth !!    Her attention to her customers is beyond the call of duty .... Love the food love the people in Steiner's ..
Thank you !!

Wife and I rolled in late, didn't feel like cooking and decided to give this place a try. Glad we did!

Friendly, informative servers, great drink selection, vibrant atmosphere, plenty of flatscreens for sports, and solid food made this joint one we'll definitely come back to. 

I had the Kobe burger with steak fries and a Blue Moon while my wife had the Santa Fe chicken sandwich. Both were good and reasonably priced. Ignore the strip mall location and give it a go, you'll be pleasantly surprised. Cheers!

I live right just a couple blocks away from this place, and I love it! My roommate and I are in there a couple of times a week - both for lunch and dinner and just for drinks. 

The staff here is very friendly and the food is exactly what you want it to be from a neighborhood bar/restaurant: tasty, filling and cheap.

Wednesday's are amazing because they offer $5 hamburgers and $6 cheese burgers, along with their DELICIOUS fries. I've also become a big fan of their Summerlin Breakfast. On the weekends, if you get there before 11:00, you can get 2 eggs, bacon/sausage, hashbrowns, and choice of bread/bagel for just $4.99. Yum!

Ok.... seriously!!!! Stop the gay music steiners!! Ive been coming here regularly for about 8 years now and this needs to change. I am very disappointed! Disco?? Dance?? Im not 5 years old. If i wanted to hear that garbage id go to a bar on the strip... play some 80s and 70s... keep it original like you used to.

Had a quick bite late night to eat here. i chose the patty melt (homemade thousand island topping) with a side of beer-battered delicious onion rings and diet coke with multiple limes. date got  their cheeseburger topped with onion and a generous slab of bacon, ordered medium. the steak fries were hot and perfectly seasoned. Lotsa tvs in this place, viewable from every vantage point; a perfect venue for watching football on sundays. They also serve breakfast and have a variety of beers on tap.  Very clean, attentive waiter, sparkling flatware and ladies' restroom was spic and span. all the things a girl notices in a casual, make-yourself-at-home kind of bar.

This has been my go-to happy hour place for about a decade now. 2 for 1 drinks and 50% off appetizers. And the best part is it's delightfully consistent and so low key. It's great after work with coworkers especially when you need variety and don't want to spend a fortune. I suggest signing up for the loyalty program because those points add up quickly and the rewards are stellar.

walked in for a wed happy hour at 3:30 there was a sign on every machine saying max bet only during happy hour. then It said (NO SITTING ON YOUR 20"S) I just wanted a beer and a burger and maybe blow 20 bucks on  a machine, but i guess $50 is not enough for this bar i will find another bar to go to
Omg ! Fun neighborhood bar with good food  ! Staff is very friendly and know there jobs and clearly like there jobs good job in making a good experience great
Great atmosphere and great service. Go for the buy one get one free happy hour and get a Cesar burger, you won't be disappointed.

I had expectations for this restaurant that were not met. I love Lamb Chops, and there chops were decent, but for $13.95 they were thin and small.

My French Dip was as average as it gets. Au jus was plain, and the amount of beef was disappointing. My wife's flat-iron steak sandwich was good, or at least that's what she said. 

In summation, I just wasn't impressed with anything the way I thought I would be after reading other reviews.

Every couple of months, I travel to Las Vegas for work.  I always stay with my friend and colleague.  He knows that I am "all about" local bars.  Steiner's is definitely one!

I have never eaten at Steiner's, we just go in to drink and gamble!

The female bartenders that work the evening shift are fantastic.  They are very quick with a drink and are great at predicting the need for a refill.  They are fun to talk to and I was completely impressed that they remembered me and what I drank even though it had been six months.

The clientele is mostly casual working stiffs with the occasional local drunk mixed in.  It is a great bar to hang out for a few hours and release the stress of the week.  Their selections of alcohol are adequate and I was impressed they carried the 18 year old Jameson.  

Whenever you are in Vegas and want to get away from all of the fake wannabe millionaires on the strip, go to e great local bar like Steiner's.

One of the older blonde servers here is a nightmare! I love steiner's but one of the servers here should find a new job! She does not care about giving good service, she takes her time to do everything; maybe she should retire from being a server. Anytime she is there I leave!!! I will not tip her or do any business with her. NO MATTER HOW MUCH I DO LOVE STEINER'S!!

Just ordered the steak fajita salad. Went for the full size, assuming it'd be underwhelming. Wish I'd have taken a pic before digging in, because this thing was massive. Thought it was overpriced, but the steak I got on it was a decent size and a great cut, absolutely zero fat or gristle, and I'm super, super picky about that. The salsa ranch is good, nothing crazy, but good. Bartender is fast but offish. Maybe because she doesn't know me. Nothing offensive, and it's not like I'm super approachable in general due to looking like a criminal in most situations. My only gripe is the music. It's like every horrible 80s-90s midnight bowling / high school pep rally song rolled into one nightmare radio channel. Currently it's "good vibrations" and my brain is about to explode.

We came once before but couldn't stay because a relative was underage (18). This is my only issue coming to this place. I've only been here once. I was visiting family in the area so we decided to go again. Nice atmosphere, typical 'pub' look. We went in the afternoon and it was desolate, which was good. 

I ordered the santa fe chicken sandwich. So good! the sourdough bread was delicious. I made the mistake of getting those death valley chips though. The way it was explained reminded me of criss cut fries from carls jr (which I like) but they weren't. They were more like lays potato chips, I should've got fries. My mistake. 

I judge the service based on how long it takes to get me a refill of soda. Our server was on top of it. I was half way done and there was another one on my table. They did run out of Dr. Pepper though, which was weird. 

I'd go back again.

It was LOUD.  Loud is a deal-breaker for me.  This is my 5th time at Steiners but the first time I've been so totally turned off!  Last night was blasting-headache-inducing noise with the music cranked way up.  The service was casual to an extreme, the tables had not been cleaned and I was disappointed in the food.  We both had the angel hair pasta (tasty) with shrimp (bland).  Probably if you want to watch the game and are into the "Cheers" atmosphere mentioned earlier, with a burger and beer, this will work.  But for an evening when you can sit and yak, kick back and catch up with friends, not so much.

Loved the food but found the atmosphere kinda creepy.  I stopped in for lunch and felt the lights were turned down way to low for that time of day.  The Cuban sandwhich was excellent and I'm a fan of their thick cut beer battered fries. With a beer and tip the bill came to $20 which I feel is too pricy for lunch in Vegas.

I wanted to watch both games tonight, and immediately thought of Steiners.  I know what you're thinking: "Its a Monday, why not just watch the games at home?"  If you're in the playoffs of your fantasy league you don't sit on the couch, you get off your ass and find that $@%in dog!  (do you know the movie?) 

I walked in to a  comfy cozy, Christmas light-lit bar. I knew I'd be ordering the Samuel Smith's Taddy Porter, gracias Ken M. once more for the great review.  What made tonight great, were the happy hour specials.  They had two for one beers, ALL BEERS.  So my Taddy Porter was $2.50 a bottle, insanity.  Since my girlfriend doesn't drink, I had to have two at the same time, it wouldn't have been right to order one...quit judging.  

Appetizers were also discounted, so after a round of scrumptiously priced buffalo chicken fingers and the beers, I couldn't have been happier.  

Oh, and they had some promotion going on where a guy on a mic was giving stuff away at halftime.  It sounded fun, but I was too invested in my libations to pay much attention.  

Steiners is where you want to be.
I really like this place , good beer , good food and they have  all the football games

Steiner's let's have a talk, you serve food and allow people to smoke cigarettes, but cigars are over the line? To non smokers there isn't a difference, they both stink! Cigarettes cling to everything, your hair, clothes, hands and especially the room. I can smoke a cigar inside and a hour later you can't smell it. So please a reply would or a post on your Yelp would be appreciated.

First of all I found this place by accident (looking for beach pizza)... I am from California yet I really enjoyed this place... Sandwich was very good...fries and onion rings were great... Service is good and even if it's a little noisy... It's a good place to come and enjoy a good sandwich and enjoy the company you are with...

Our server,  Katrina,  made our Sunday Funday better than expected! ! We had such a good time!
 And then, shift changed,  and the new bartender was totally rude, and we are leaving. (Asian Chic, Sunday afternoon).

My daughter and I used to live eating here- a Friday dinner, Sunday brunch. The eating area is clearly separate from the bar yet for some strange reason, they refuse to allow families now. I'm sure they've lost money because of this. Other bars still allow minors, so we go there! Too bad- maybe they'll change back.

This was the first time me and my girlfriend came here. We had the waiter pick our hamburgers. I had the Trojan hamburger and my girlfriend had the New York style hamburger. They were good. The place was very clean and the people were nice. The waiter Guinness was very polite and helpful.  We will be coming back again.  Thanks    PS every body in there had human conversation and not on their phones.

This place couldn't be more different during the day than at night.

Late night, you can't really beat their food specials, and the service is always excellent on the third shift.

During the day and at night however, this place is kind of a drag. They are total nazis about carding people (even those who are obviously 30+) and it gets really annoying. I understand that you can't serve people under 21 but seriously, develop and use some judgment and common sense, and remember your customers, instead of pretending to forget someone. In general, the servers seem intent on finding ways to avoid serving you, rather than trying to help you have a good experience. Perhaps they are so focused on gaming that they view non-gamers as a hassle, if this is the case, they have done a very good job of passively-aggressively making it clear.

The menu is overpriced and fairly pedestrian, although they do offer really good specials at different times.

Done here on a regular basis. Food is always good and love the Kobe burger and chicken piccata. Fridays prime rib is some of the best in Summerlin area. Service is almost always outstanding. Managerial staff sometimes acts like customers are an inconvenient part of their job. Have visited and watched groups get rowdy and vulgar and manager accommodate them despite other customers complaints. No fun dining with staggering drunks as a backdrop. Have only witnessed a few times though. Will definitely return despite its issues.

What can I say about Steiners???  For the past 8 years, I set a countdown until the day I return to Steiners for their "Big Game Party."  Roger and his staff has welcomed me and my boys from New Jersey back each year and has never failed to outdo the year before.

The food is fantastic, the atmosphere is warm and the staff gets better and better every year!!! 

Over the years, we have brought crowds, both big and small to the party and no matter how much we "Sell" the party, no one has ever said we overstated the quality offered at Steiners!!!  This is truly a Las Vegas experience that should not be missed.  

Great People, Incredible food, and Best in class Atmosphere... Only 355 days left until next year!!!

Great Beer selection.  Try and sit close to the beer fridge so you can see the micro and import selection.  Some beers are not on the menu.  They have the BEST frenchfries in Las Vegas and home made ranch yum!  My husband and I pretty much make Steiners our go-to pub.

So I actually like the food here, but this is now the 2nd time I've had bad service from a bartender with an attitude problem.

My most recent trip I came in and sat at the bar with a friend. I started gambling when I sat down (the first inning of a baseball game). About 2 mins After I hit 0.00 (the top of the third) the bar tender said "are you going to gamble more? Because the owner is giving me dirty looks".  Wow. Never had that happen. That's one way to make your customer feel welcome! I'm by no means a big time gambler. I was in $20.00 and my friend was in $150.00. We ordered food and we're just hanging out watching the World Series. I didn't realize I was on a timer.

I get it, I'm not a Vegas newbie. However there were open machines and I had no intention of milking it. The wings here are good, but after this experience I'll never be back.

I had been to another Steiner's a year ago and thought I'd give this location a go this time around. Needless to say, I was VERY happy to give it a shot.

First and foremost, the deals they have during football games - college and pro - are enough to make ANYONE want to stop in. Amazing app deals, great discounts on everything (including a kobe beef burger), and some damn nice giveaways. If you're in Vegas for over a weekend, and don't want to sit on the strip (which why would you these days?), hit up Steiners for a game, you won't regret it.

Onto the review! Don't want the normal bar food, look here. My cousin and I were able to make a nearly custom meal. Wasn't an option, but, I had to ask for a grilled, diced chicken omelet. No problem. Not on the menu, but, my cousin asked for a buffalo chicken sammy - bam, no problem. 

And, the ingredients, and food, very very solid for a sports bar. The omelet (diced chicken, cheddar and avocado) was fantastic. Perfectly fluffy, great amount of sharp, tasty cheese and perfectly grilled up chicken boob. Hashbrowns were killer too. Solid crunch on the outside with a great golden appearance. Only gripe, some cold rye toast which tells me they miss timed dropping them.

Bartender was fantastic and very accommodating. Can't wait to head back when I hit the desert again.

Love this place!!! All the food is good and consistently good! The Lamb Chops are to die for. The atmosphere is fun and noisy, the specials are delicious and you can't beat the every night Happy Hour-2 for 1 drinks, which keep coming The best thing about this location is the waiter Patrick. He always remembers us and our drinks. He takes your order, doesn't write it down and always gets it right!

BF is a huge fan of this place- fond memories of their late night menu and quite a few game day beerfests. He vaguely remembered their prime rib being excellent, so we stopped in for dinner on a Friday night.

Sure enough, signage at the door confirmed that Friday is prime rib night, 7-11PM. Discrepancy with the menu though, which states that dinner specials are 7-10PM. Either way, they were down to only well-done prime rib by 9PM, so I guess that's the day you're supposed to get there at 7 exactly or just cross your fingers.

Good bar for a game, plenty of beers and lots of screens. LIked the cozy booths and the variety of seating options available. Don't know if they offer more game day specials for appetizers, but the prices were a little high, IMO.

I went for the chili and side salad combo: $10; BF opted for a burger with a side of homemade chips and a beer, $10. Total came to about $25, so not bad all together, but I felt it was overpriced for what it was. BF would likely only return for late night menu pricing.

Salad was nothing to write home about, dressing was bottled and not particularly flavorful (bleu cheese). Chili was surprisingly bland despite being drenched in cheese and onions. Not sure how they managed that one. Had high hopes considering it's made with black beans and sirloin, but it seemed like it was old. Later that night I had a stomach ache, lesson learned.

BF's burger had swiss, bacon, and grilled onions, though I can't remember the name. I found it to be dry and flavorless, BF didn't think it was that bad. Though we ordered the chips, burger arrived with fries- server immediately caught the error and brought us an extra side of the chips.

Verdict was that we should have stuck with the fries, which were much better. Chips were impressive in that they were superthin and waffle-cut: no clue how that happens, and it was cool, but they were also overly greasy and lacked crunch, and weren't particularly flavorful. The Lawry's seasoning only seemed to be on about 1/4 of the dish.

Service was attentive and friendly, beer was cold and good, food was meh. Would go back for a game, but would probably eat before coming here.

I'm probably going to get raked across the coals since this is def. a locals favorite.

Thanksgiving at Steiner's:  
1.  First of all, it was freezing.  In the restaurant.  Warmer outside.  I kept my coat on as we were seated.
2.  We were seated at a tabled, ordered, received our drinks, told we had to move to another table since our current table was reserved for people who NEVER SHOWED UP.  The manager actually told the waitress to have us move IN FRONT OF US, having the waitress be the bad guy rather than dirty her own hands.
3.  I asked if I could order the pumpkin pie separately out of the Thanksgiving deal.  I was told no.  Even asked if I could pay EXTRA.  Nope, no bueno.   I went next door and gave my money to the grocery store and ate an entire one following said meal.
4.  My sandwich was cold.  HOWEVER!  The fries were delicious, and seasoned very well.

So  I dropped by months later overnight, you know, non-Thanksgiving to try them out on a regular late night.
The bartender was cranky, when we asked if could change out potatoes for french fries, a short, "We don't do that here" was thrown back at us.  Unfriendly, uninspiring, average prices.  

Good fries, though.

Steiner's is a favorite of our friends so my husband and I find ourselves there fairly often.  They have a huge menu & a huge booze selection to go along with a ton of TVs for the sport you want to watch that day.  The food is typical pub/bar food but much better - the food is delicious.  I highly recommend the fried chicken basket!  They also have a great rewards card that will earn you points for every dollar spent.  Once you reach so many points, they mail you a gift card.  They also send you free meal coupons on your birthday & your anniversary! Oh - & the drink specials are killer!  2 for 1 during happy hour & they literally bring you two of what you order.  Double fist it!

Service at the bar was fast and attentive.  I had the pretzel and two dark beers; Modelo Negra (always fine) and a Victory Imperial Stout! I was impressed by both the body and the smooth but bold flavors in this beer. Buen apetito!
Best food in town hands down. Atmosphere is great service is phenomenal and the staff is all friendly
I ordered the most simplist thing there..the chicken tenders. Food tasted frozen. Service was on point tho. Im just rating the food.

Very impressed . My wife and I decided to try it and were pleasantly surprised . Greeted with a smile by the server , fast service , excellent food.  
Definitely going to be coming back

Excellent service!!

Came in around 5 on a random Tuesday and the place was fairly busy.  Expected slow service but was pleasantly surprised by quick, friendly, efficient service all around!

Had the house Chardonnay, not too bad when it's happy hour 2-for-1.

Also thoroughly enjoyed the lamb chops, cooked to perfection!!

I just moved across the street from this place and have found my new local bar!!

A co-worker of mine recommend this place to me so me and a friend of mine went to check it out at lunch. I must say this place by far has the best environment to relax watch sports, eat lunch, or even just have a few drinks. 

The ambience is awesome!!! Lots of cool pictures and memorabilia around. The seating is setup with space and comfortable for large parties. 

For lunch I had the Ruben with fries. The food was delicious!! Cooked to perfection with some of the best fries I ever had. The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is I couldn't drink being on lunch break. 


I highly recommend this place to anyone for food, sports or a simple outing.  The lady at the bar was awesome great personality and very social!! 


GO CHECK IT OUT!!
Great bartenders (Jennifer is so freaking nice and make perfect drinks).  the food is good bar food and they have a good beer selection

Best "Happy Hour" in Vegas. The specials they run for HH from half price appetizers (nachos my favorite either get in chicken or beef) and all domestic or import beers 2 for 1. They really do great job comes beer put the second draft or bottle on ice. The selection on draft beers is very diverse one that enjoy checking out micro brews section. Lot of good micro brews from the US and always seem like new one added when I go. The prices are very reasonable.

The food always good. I tend too get the sandwiches or burgers. Every time the sandwiches nice hot, fresh, and french fries good. My favorite is the reuben sandwich! I love the thousand island sauce. The whole combination the pastrami really could eat by itself. 

The bar area is great they have lots of televisions too watch the games on. It one if not the only place that get the NHL package. I love NHL and hockey one biggest passions in life. It refreshing too see bar naturally has other three but nice watch NHL game have venue too watch favorite team. They always tend too have some kind of giveaway each week. Also have players card that earn points towards food or beverages. 

The wait staff is all friendly, great management always walking around making sure your meal is great and attentive. If not so far away would go more often..

Pretty good food for a bar... Oops... I meant for a Nevada style pub! A little pricey however if you go during happy hour, the two for one drink special makes it worth it. I love that it's open 24 hours... Great for an insomniac like me. The burgers are good , that Bavarian pretzel is nice and the fries are amazing. Love the lamb chops. By the way, the Kobe beef hamburger is obviously not true Kobe beef from Japan, since the Wynn is the only place in USA with real Kobe beef.
Sunny is the best bartender in Vegas! Love going in late night to eat and have a night cap.

My wife and I came in for dinner tonight after reading the reviews.  The giant pretzel was amazing, but that is about it.  My wife had the Kobe hamburger and I had the lamb chops.  The beef was tender and good but the rest if the burger was nothing special.  The lamb chops were tiny with very little meat.   The whole meal was way over priced.  The place was nice but not for the price of the food.  Probably won't be back except for the pretzel.

From out of town and went with friends....food was mediocre at best. The check came before we wanted to leave, really wanted more drinks. Paid and went to the bar, the bartender told us the bar was reserved. What? Can you reserve bar space? She was terribly rude so we went down the street to spend our money on slots and booze.

There are several things that I like about Steiner's...and a few I areas where it just doesn't manage to stand out.

They have a decent draft list, but a much better craft beer list.  

I love that they have multiple "bar food" items that stand out as well.  The nachos are individual chips made into perfect bites with a little bit of everything on each chip.  They have a bratwurst in a pretzel bun that is ridiculously good.

They have a great value for breakfast as well.

That being said I am just too much of a foodie and beer snob to truly appreciate it, but when friends from work or grad classes want to meet somewhere Steiner's is a welcome choice over the myriad of usual bars around. 

Some other highlights:

Drink Happy Hour Monday through Friday 4PM to 7PM

Value priced appetizers Monday through Friday 3PM to 6PM

Graveyard Specials
1AM to 7AM Every Day
$2 Domestic Draft Beers
2AM to 7AM Summerlin Breakfast

Don't come in with the baby not even to the restaurant side. Unbelievable. Been to a lot of different places in Las Vegas including yard house and other restaurants that serve alcohol and have never had a problem bringing a baby. We were asked to leave.

We went to this pub after checking in to our resort and we were very satisfied.  It was around 10:15 on a Sunday night and the place was empty so the service was fast.  I ordered a salad which was fantastic and fresh, and my husband had some sort of steak sandwich. The portions were just right and the prices were reasonable.  We both would recommend it to anyone who wanted bar food in a pub environment.  It was a good way to end a day of travel.

Stopped in for drinks only.  We sat at the bar and had to wait for the waitress to appear.  Probably over 10 minutes.  I think we was busy flirting with the cook or something.  Her drinks were really tasty but not cheap!  Holy moly!  I was worried I was going to have to sell my first born to pay our tab,

I was really impressed with this visit to Steiner's.  Our service was friendly and attentive.   The beer choice was good serving many great local and regional brews in bottles and drafts.  

Our food was delicious.  The portions were large and fairly priced.  I had one of the grilled chicken sandwiches and it was a very large breast with lots of toppings to accompany it.  French fries are awesome and at least a pound serving.

You may have had one of those days when you're really up in the air about what and where to eat. It's here where places like Steiner's shine. You have no idea what to eat? Steiner's has it on their menu! Everything is cooked to order and the drinks are as stuff as they come.  It may not be the most excellent food out there but for what they prepare, they prepare it well and what more could an unsure yummy ask for?
Good Food. Good Prices.  A little dark, and a bit hard to maneuver with a handicapped person.  Very nice service.

I joined some friends at Steiner's for a hockey game and the staff was great! I was surprised they carried Lindemans Framboise and that earned them their 4 stars. The food was great, I splurged and got their Kobe Burger, and my medium patty was medium! :D They would have gotten their 5 stars if the Framboise wasn't soo pricey. 

I would definitely go back again.
Been coming here since I was a kid. Always great food and great service. Jalapeno took excellent care of us!!
Cozy..great food and a friendly atmosphere..Love the sports/tv views.  Not too nosy. :)  Go there often enough to get free food!  Fun promotionals.

Been coming to this Steiner's for a couple years now, but just started on Yelp so I thought I should share my impressions. It's in a strip mall very close to Albertsons. Parking is pretty good and the atmosphere is very Nevada friendly as is the menu. Lots of dishes named after places in Nevada. Most folks don't know half the places but we folks that have lived here (came here in '78) and I appreciate the effort.

The person that greeted us at the door was very friendly and welcoming. Our waitress, Kelly, was on top of everything we needed and more as was the young lady the refreshed my wife's ice tea. They both made sure we had full drinks and that I could watch the PBR (Professional Bull Riders) on one of the screens. OUTSTANDING!!!!!!!! I normally leave after dinner but we stayed and had a few more drinks and even went to the bar to gamble a couple C's. One more thing about our waitress Kelly, when I said we would like a couple more drinks to watch the PBR she said please stay you are our guests and we welcome you to stay. HOLY CRAP!!!!!!! Bravo Kelly, give that gal a raise (just don't raise the price of the beers....) she is the only reason we stayed. So, on a rating of 0-5 I give them a 5 on atmosphere and service.

Now onto the food review...I ordered the flat iron steak, my wife ordered the special pot roast for a Saturday. I am a pretty plain sort of eater, don't like sauces and that sort of stuff...so I ordered double veggies with nothing on them and a medium rare steak. Perfection on both orders. My wife was so thrilled by the pot roast she "forced" me to try it even though it had gravy. OK, not a gravy guy but I could have eaten every bit of her dinner, just the best. My steak was perfect the veggies were steamed with nothing on them just the way "I" like them. So on a rating of 0 to 5, I give them a 5 on food.

From there we went to the bar to watch the rest of the PBR and do a little gambling. The clientele at the bar was more than inviting, one fellow even moved down a machine so we could sit. There wasn't the machine I like but there was one at the end of the bar and the fellow there said he was leaving in 10 mins and we could have it then, so we waited. While waiting we 3 had a wonderful conversation about Nevada, Las Vegas, the Rodeo and the PBR. After he left I took over his machine, played 2 C's and won back a little while getting great service from the bartender who I did not get her name, shame on me, I think her name was Christy, she was very nice. We had been in there other times when the bar staff was not as nice as she and I would love to give her credit. So on a rating of 0 to five on the gambling I have to give it a 5.

On this evening the Steiner's on Buffalo had terrific service, the food was great and the experience was one that would makes us tell others to go there, and we would definitely come back again. The d√©cor is worth the visit alone, the staff was courteous and friendly, the food choices are diverse and the gaming is as good as any gaming is in Las Vegas.  So I "Yelp" this place 5 stars...thanks for a great Saturday night out.

Consistently good!  Went with friends for dinner and everything was great.  It is very hard for find fried chicken in Las Vegas but they have it and they do it fantastically.  The breading in tasty and crispy while the chicken is really juicy.  My husband and our friends had burgers and they all enjoyed their meals.  On the waiter's recommendation my girlfriend substituted a portobello mushroom for the meat and she said it was delicious.  Oh, and the fries were perfectly done too.  Definitely a good "go to" place.
Great local bar! The staff always remembers us and says hello. Actually ended up here for Christmas dinner with my mom and had a great time lol. The food specials are great and love the happy hour.

It was great!  I had the patty melt as we watched the Lakers on one of the many TVs.  The cole slaw tasted fake though.  But I will go back and try something else.

Service was A+

I live in walking distance to Steiners and really want to like it, however, the bartenders have been below average most times I've been in. I especially HATE that cigarettes are allowed and not cigars! It should be no smoking or cigars allowed! Cigarettes smell worse than cigars because they are full of chemicals and paper! Premium cigars are pure whole leaf tobacco, thus they do not linger as long as cigars. Also, when I lit my cigar the bar tender was very rude about it. It's not what you say, it's how you say it! I cashed out and left immediately after the exchange.

It's too bad because, the food is pretty good here. I really liked the Chinese chicken salad. Service needs to be improved and change your cigar policy, God forbid high end customers come in with their fancy cigars.

I ordered from here on Xmas because I was desperate and didn't want to cook. My Mom and I love sandwiches and fries and this place seemed to have good reviews.  When you walk in it's like walking into a dark but cozy friends home.  Various and fun little plaques on the walls say positive or funny things to keep the environment light.  There is a huge bar with surrounding tables and it almost always seems busy (despite being in a parking lot next to Albertsons).  I ordered the cuban sandwich and it was litle salty but the fries were amazing.  I went back there the other day and ordered the Orleans chicken sandwich and it was so good!  Spicey chicken with blue cheese and bacon!  Despite my not wanting to eat a lot of meat (especially pork - poor pigs) I ate this and dang it - I loved it!  Their prices are really reasonable and I look forward to going there with a friend and having a drink (and maybe some um..fries...try to stop me :-))

This place is what it is. The draft beer is really cheap and tastes fine. I haven't had the fries, but the person I was with didn't like them at all. The seating is not ideal, because if you want a casual drink you basically have to sit in the bar or these booths that look a bit dated. I was a little confused walking in because we sat at stools adjacent to the bar, but no server came. So we realized we had to walk up to the bar to order, which was a bit strange.

The crowd doesn't seem too bad. If you want cheap beer while smoking cigarettes, this spot is ok. I just wouldn't expect much more than that.

I always end up spending more money than I mean too when I go to this place. 
Some of the stuff on the menu is a little pricey for what it is, but they do have good specials every day of the week, as well as happy hour and graveyard specials, so I can't complain about that too much. 
I love the grilled cheese sandwich with ham and fries.. I know it's simplest darn thing, but it's to DIE for. Whatever ham they use, I hope they keep using it. The summerlin breakfast special they have at night is pretty good too. I've also had the nachos as well. While they weren't they greatest nachos in the world, they do the trick for your nacho craving.
Good food but expensive for what you get.  ($15 for a chicken Caesar salad).  I don't go as often as I used to because of that.

The decor is classic dark brew pub. It works. A nice place to hang with your friends or just chill by yourself.

An above average pub menu. The breakfast menu is pretty good, with lots of choices. We like it - my sweetie loves to come here.

Today we showed up a bit late for breakfast, so we fastened onto the lunch menu. Again,  lots of choices. I went with the "round mountain" roast beef sandwich,  my sweetie went with the Paradise Carnita sandwich. We both had the home made chips,,, my sandwich was okay -- it was as advertised -- but it was kinda bland for my taste. Not Steiner 's fault,  the roast beef sandwich would be killer for someone with a blander palette than mine.  The Paradise Carnita sandwich was absolutely KILLER.
So full of flavor -- an awesome choice,  sweetie loved it as did I.  I know what Im ordering on my next visit.  Pulled pork ( carnita style )  with spicy sauce and pico de gallo served on a sweet sourdough roll. Amazing sandwich.

Good selection of beers - on tap and in bottles. Service was good,  and the prices are fair. Recommended.

Came in for a late dinner after a convention, and was really happy (as always) with the staff and the food. nachos were great, Angus sliders delicious, lemon chicken crisp on the outside and tender on the inside, with tome of pasta. Service was great, as usual, even though we were in pretty late (between 10-11pm)

So my wife and I met some friends here. We wanted to eat and have a few drinks to celebrate. The waiter must have been new. I asked him about some of the beers they showed on the menu and he was clueless. I asked him about the draft beer and he didnt know what they had. Finally I decided to just have a Coors Light on draft and he brought me a Miller Lite. This was the first mistake. We ordered our food. My friend ordered Fried Chicken and it came out still cold in the middle almost frozen.....WOW. She had to return it and waited an additional 20 minutes while everyone else had there food. My other buddy had Fish & Chips, he said it was fantastic. Then our other friend ordered the steak sandwich and she said it was ok accept she had to pick off the onions that she asked them to hold. My wife and I ordered the sampler. This was NOT impressive. The chicken wings were supposed to be plain and they were spicy. The fingers were hard and way over cooked. The onion rings were great and the potato wedges were the bomb.com. After we at we decided to have a shot of Hennessey to finish off the night and the waited forgot to bring one out so we had to wait again. Yes I am being hard on this place because for such a nice establishment they hired some boneheads to work there. I watched a waitress and a waiter make out were the put in the orders. This is right in front of the customer. No wonder our order wasnt right and they kept forgetting things. The owner should take a long hard look at his or hers staff. At least the cook came out and apologized for the Fried Chicken mishap. Thumbs down to this Steiners due to the lack of professionalism from the staff and the quality of the food.
Don't get me wrong, steiner's is one of my favorite places but, the "hashed browns" served this morning were horrible!  It was like a paste that was smeared onto the griddle & cooked.  So sad

This is definitely my favorite spot to watch sporting events. They have a great happy hour during football games where you buy any beer and you get the second one free. Their food is also fantastic and everything is cheap (typically I can get a burger, fries, and two 22oz beers for about $20). All of their staff is friendly and you're never sitting with an empty cup. Highly recommended!
Best restaurant in town. I love this place already. Excellent everything. Food is delicious. I want to go back again soon. I hope this place stays in business forever.
Good food, drinks, price and service. Great atmosphere.

Best food and people! Their lamb chops, nachos and their burgers with fries are my favorite go to dishes. Their staff and the whole vibe is like Cheers. I've been coming here for years and will keeping coming for years. Sometimes you will even catch a celebrity in here.

What can you say about Steiners... It's always good food here and almost always fantastic service. Always feels like the place the locals go to and that's what I like about it. Also get Steiners to go quite a bit. Their appetizers are very very tasty and their entr√©es are huge. Great value in a great place to take friends and family

This location was the former official game day bar for my local Alumni Club.  Last season we watched all of the football games here on Saturday and had a section reserved for our group.  This year we changed locations because of logistics for people throughout the Valley.  

I stopped in here for old time's sake on Saturday to watch a few games and enjoy a few Blue Moon's.  The place was busy but not too packed.  I wasn't very hungry, so I passed on food and just enjoyed my Blue Moon.  However, in the past I've enjoyed their Kobe Burger and Nachos.  Those 2 dishes stand out for me.

The service was great, as usual.  It's a very casual joint, so come here in your jersey and jeans to enjoy a few drinks and some grub.

Will I return?  You can count on it!

We had a good time here at Steiner's. They have great beer specials and fantastic wings and offer an awesome array of pub food that they've put their own spin on. It's a fantastic place to come to watch a game (although a few of the TVs could use some updating) but overall its a pretty legit place that we'll definitely come back to.

I don't think I've been in here in about 4 years, so I figured it was time to give it another shot.  Had a few beers tonight and was a bit disappointed.  They have a big beer list, but I couldn't find anything that met my expectations.  Ended up having an Abita Purple Haze, which tasted watered down, and some other beer the bartender recommended, which was OK.  Actually the bartender was probably the only selling point of this place... her name is Sheila, and I remember her from when I used to go here back in the day.  She didn't remember me, but she is super friendly.  I'm going to give this place a few more tries, and then go back to Roadrunner as my local joint...

I have been coming to Steiner's since it opened in 1998 (Cheyenne & Durango location). I really do like their food.  I am pretty familiar with the menu and, for the most part, hasn't changed since they opened.  In my opinion, Steiner's is the reason that bar food in Vegas has been elevated past chicken wings & burgers.

Some of my favorite items are the Death Valley Chips, Oasis Cobb Salad, Flamingo Chicken Sandwich, and the Sinful Frozen Cappuccino Pie.  There are daily lunch & dinner specials as well as great daily soups (chicken noodle is my fav!).

The beer list is long; 20 different drafts, 60 or more different bottled ales/beers/ciders.  

The staff is very friendly and service is very prompt.  Be aware, late at night, food is available, but you have to order at the bar since there is usually not waitstaff.

Seating is seat yourself with high tables, low tables, a party bar, and booths as well as gaming seating at the bar.  The decor is Nevada History Kitschy.  As with most bars when it has been busy, the smoke in the air is a little bothersome, but overall, Steiner's is my go to place for a local bar/restaurant for one excellent reason: consistency.

Worst of the Steiner's bunch I have been to. First of all it took forever for a server to help us, then the burger was overlooked when I ordered rare and then I forgot my to go box as I went to the car, came back 2 minutes later and they tossed it. Worst of all I didn't even get an apology or anything. Just a shrug. Never again.
Try the Kobe Sliders...and the sweet potato fries. They always have a game on as well...

This is our version of Cheers. You know. Where everybody knows our name. 

This pub is really a versatile place. It changes from family dining to sports bar to kick back pub everyday. And its really conducive to all our different circles of friends. 

The bartenders and wenches are all SUPER friendly and willing to please. Now that I think about it, I'm really spoiled by this place. 

While we haven't yet memorized the menu, we've memorized everything that we like on the menu. Touting myself as a french fry connoisseur, I like to think that Steiner's beer-battered fries are among the elite. Bf loves the wings, extra hot. They also have a creme brulee. Its not great, but if ever I have a creme brulee craving at 2 in the am ...

Cape cod city! Yay!

Heather $. And I were ready to get drunk and sloppy, we decided Steiners was a good place to go! Just kidding about the drunk and sloppy part! Lol. Steiners is like 3.6 mins from my place so I was off!

We arrived and it was quiet inside, we arrived late so it was nice to not have a crowd and cray crays all over the place. We sat and our bartender asked if we were hungry and took our drink order and gave us menus.

I ordered a cape codder and Heather got the special beer. It was nice pay only 4$ for a Smirnoff cape cod, and he made it soooooo yummy! 

Service was great even though there was only 2 ppl working that night! I will be sure to come back for the eats!
Best wings I've had in Vegas!They are huge & garlic injected.great beer specials & friendly staff.I give it 5 stars just because their food really is Superb
Love their Mediterranean salad and bloody Mary. Also the deserts. Our favorite spot. Great service.
I had a bratwurst with a pretzel roll.  Best brat I've had in a looooong time!

Dear Chad B. First of all, if you want to use Yelp learn how to use it. None of these bartenders you mentioned work at the Buffalo location. Second, I have lived in Nevada for 27 years and the 2 bartenders you mentioned are two of the best bartenders I have ever had. Your yelp review is false and all locals should ignore it for both the Buffalo location and the girls he mentioned location.
Exactly what you want from your local pub. Good friendly service and decent food. Sunny in particular is awesome!

This is a great pub with so many beer selections it's hard to know where to start. I love Warsteiner beer. Regardless, the food is amazing here. I recommend the Wagyu burger or Soprano salad (only served on Thursdays). Whatever you get, be sure to save room for the Sinful pie, a delicious espresso ice cream pie with chocolate in a rice crispie crust! The server, Patrick, was great, too.

I only ever come here because a girl I know likes a particular beer they serve here and at the Yardhouse. Personally, I think her beer is ok, but I like to stick to my Corona's. 

Now, when I review a bar, I usually rate it on the following fluid criteria: was the beer cold? was the food good for a bar? was service ok? and were prices in line with the place? I've never had the food here, so I cannot speak to that, but regarding everything else...

On my last trip here, I purchased 3 Coronas, and the lady ordered four of her beers. Total was around $35, which I thought was kinda high. But then again, this place isn't a PT's: the environment is slightly more uppity, as evidenced by their nicer menus. Service was pretty good most of the night, though at the end a larger party came in and they seemed to forget about the two of us. Fail. 

All in all, this place is cool. I'll probably come here again, but it's not my first choice over a PT's.
Fun bar great food. Fish and chops are amazing.

Used to frequent here after work with coworkers until one evening we sat down at the bar & before we even sat a bartender rudely said "are you guys gonna play cause we're very strict about that!" We were all like WOW! We not only played but also ordered food & because we were still playing our original $20 bill we put in(machine didn't hit big was letting us stay alive) our next drinks weren't comped because the bartender said it's based on what you spend! Ever hear of customer service lady? I'll go to Mad Matty's on Sahara after work where they know how to treat their customers & if I want Steiner's wings I'll go to the LV Blvd location.

The food is great with a good selection. They even have a great breakfast. The staff is super friendly and you may even get a visit from the manager to make sure you are happy. They have the best happy hour in town, 2 for 1! It will be your new favorite hangout.

A personal favorite for ten years! Today was lamb chops and mundo Burger. No matter what you get, you can't go wrong. Service is always in point too. And of course fantastic bartenders and drink options.

We went to the bar recently and we had a terrible customer experience! It took about 15 minutes to get our drink orders in, the food took another 20 minutes, the refills never got to us and the bill.. well that was pretty fast! The food was really not that good. We ordered the nachos for appetizer and although they were very good you only get about 10-15 nachos. I guess i'm used to eating tons of nachos that this size portion was just not enough for me. 
I'm a beer lover and this place has tons of international beers!!! I think i might come back just for that!
Good atmosphere and vibes, but the food always seems over priced to me. It is still good bar food, but a little more expensive than a pt's. I would go back because it's close, but never blown away.

This is a decent locals bar to stop in for a quick drink. They have video poker and food at the bar as well. The one odd thing is, it looks exactly like the other Steiners inside- I mean exact. If you've been to the other one you've been to this one. Service is decent, same food menu, a decent stop for a quick drink.

Updating from last review... What happened to the customer service? It use to be so good, this use to be one of my number one spots to go for brekfest (their french toast it amazing), but the service def makes me re think it. I havent been since June. which is sad..

I have been going to Steiners since they opened. I have gone to both locations located at Cheyenne Avenue and Buffalo Avenue. For the last several years every Thursday myself and many of my friends have met there and enjoy their food thoroughly.
As a local, this is one of the friendliest places in the neighborhood, let alone Las Vegas. I highly recommend it. The staff is friendly, competent and eager to please.

used to eat there weekly with my family and even joined their Steiner,s club.
But to allow smoking they made rule that you have to be 21.  So they lost our business and I guess other family business, so if you like your food with smoke so a few could play slot machines you found a place. 
What upset me the most is I spoke to the owner and called their rewards office abd they did not give a Damn about losing family business-they shoukd be boycotted,

Pretty good breakfast. Especially for 5:30 in the morning. I had steak and eggs. The steak was good, a bit too well done for medium rear. The service, once available was adequate. The hash browns were  a bit soggy. The big plus 24 hrs service.
Nothing beats the Steiner's 2-for-1 happy hour here. Drinks are served ice cold and the food is delicious.

Great bar good, great service and the video poker machines are usually hitting...   

If you like wings and you like hot then try the hottest wings they offer.     Highly recommended by me and I'm Awesomeness
Decent bar food, decent drinks, and decent service. Comfortable, clean atmosphere
Love the atmosphere. The food is always fantastic and the servers are friendly and efficient. Great place to stop and grab a bite.

I came here after playing a round of golf on a Saturday night with my dad and brother around 6 to grab a bite to eat and watch the Cavs game. This is the first time that I've been to this location, but I've been to the other locations multiple times. I'm a big fan of Steiner's food and think it's a great place to hang out, drink, and watch some sports.

They have booths along the outside of the restaurant which were on about a ten minute wait when we arrived. So we decided to sit immediately in the "party bar" which consisted of some high tops and a rail that split the middle of the area where you could sit to eat and drink. We sat at the rail and had an excellent view of the largest main screen which had the Cavs on.

They have an extensive beer selection that is reasonably priced. I had a 22 oz Fat Tire ($5.75) with the Kobe Burger ($13.99). My brother had the Treasure Island burger. Fries are al a carte if you want them with the burger. My burger was delicious and I was especially happy with the beef. The Saturday special is the pot roast which the gentleman across from me ordered. He said it was very good and I could tell it was because he pretty much inhaled it.

Service was prompt and attentive. We had no issues with our visit. You will definitely find me in a Steiner's again in the future.

Good food and would give it a 5 if the service was more consistent. The food is always good and enjoyable. 

They have plenty of tvs and there is always a game on. Try any of the burgers and you will not be disappointed. My wife really likes the wings. The frys and onion rings are great.

I love this place and always come here to unwind after a hard day of work. I am one of many regulars, which should speak for itself. The bartenders always recognize my friends and I and are super friendly, always conversing with us. The food is also great. Everything about this place makes it my own personal getaway. They always seem to have specials on beers, which have saved my friends and I a ton of money and have gotten us a lot of free stuff. 

If you are looking for the perfect local bar for some R&R this is the place.

The facts; average nevada bar, they have good bar food, service good, people can smoke, good place to watch sports... not cheap not expensive.

I really wish yelp would change the star system.  This place is better than a 3 star but I just can't give this a 4 star!  Damn it... I am changing it to a 4 star. No I am staying on three.  

Three stars means "a-ok."  Four stars means "Ya I'm a Fan."  

To be honest this is just a good place to have a beer and maybe some above average bar food.  With that being said I just can't say --- "Ya I'm a Fan."  So, I guess I can say it is "A-ok."  Comparatively speaking though it is better than other bars that get 3 star ratings and as good as a bar that gets 4 star ratings...  This is a dilema for me.

I guess what keeps this place from being 4 or even 5 stars are 2 things.  First, I was there with 2 buddies, we had 2 apps and some beers.  The tab was $120.  No shots or excessive drinking were talking some draught beer.  Maybe that is just the going rate these days but It rubs my rhubarb the wrong way.  Also, and this is no detriment just an observation, but it is nothing special.  Kinda boring in there.  Like I said; it is not a bad thing just nothing to blow my skirt up.

This place has a great beer selection and is worth a visit for this alone.  It also has superior bar food.   It has a nice happy hour too.  I like the lamb chops, the daily dinner specials, the appetizers (awesome German pretzels) and the chili.  The service is efficient and friendly and the ambiance is comfortable and entertaining.  Lots of cool things on the wall, televisions for sports fans and cool promotions.

I came here on a whim tonight because I was hungry. The beer selection here is impressive for a smaller bar that doesn't seem to be overly corporate. The chili is absolutely phenomenal, and I will be trying any food I can get covered in this beany, meaty goodness. Also a major plus that I live less than a five minute drive from here.

My go to for happy hour by far!~!
Great service(the best anywhere), good food at a decent price, by far the best gar food from any of the competitors.
Cons: if you want to sit at the bar and not gamble it can be challenging, most seats have machines and if its busy you will be asked to move to a table.its understandable but is a bit annoying

3.5 stars here. This is a smaller Steiners that I've been to many times. I do love the Nevada dip sandwich. They have a small bar at this location, maybe 15 games and getting a seat can be tough, especially at happy hour where they run some good drink specials. 

People overall are pretty friendly, good service from the staff. Its pretty common of all bars, nothing special here except for some better than average food items. Try the Kobe burger.

Nice low key pub in the suburbs of Vegas...not a touristy place, but more of a family favorite.  I went here for a friend after they suggested the tasty burgers...I wasn't disappointed.  To start, I had the white bean and ham soup...very tasty without being too salty...very satisfying and a great start to the meal!  Then, I had the Kobe beef sliders...topped with cheese and crispy fried onions and chipotle ketchup on the side.  Again...another great choice...I would say they were roughly 2oz each...and there were 4 of them...as opposed to my friend that had the Kobe burger which was HUGE!

I love burgers, so this was great.  The sliders were perfectly cooked...not dry at all and having them on sweet potato buns complimented the burger.

All in all, another great meal.
Omg their food is amazing! My husband and I eat here when he gets off work late. It's a cool little spot. Bartender is cool.

We started out at this Steiner's, then switched to the one on Cheyenne.  But after a few less-than-stellar meals there, we're back to where it all began.

Steiner's is, as my three stars indicates, A-OK.  Not fabulous, but not bad, either.  This time we had Chicken Piccata and a Flat Iron Ranch Steak.  Hubby's been ordering the Chicken Piccata ever since they took the "other" chicken dish off the menu, which used to come with terrific criss-cross potato crisps under the chicken and stuck into the mashed potatoes.  He misses those, though his gut and Dr. Oz are happier.  But he likes the Piccata, which comes with fresh veggies and mashed.

My steak was good, cooked a tad more medium than the medium-rare I'd requested, but not enough for me to send it back.  It came with the same sides.

This is a comfortable, neighborhood joint that we'll keep coming back to, because it's a comfortable, neighborhood joint, with decent food, good beer, and that Kool-Aid stuff - white zin - for $4.00.
